result.execSummary:
The defendant Deon P Downs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI) testing and monitoring fees

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Contact Racine Vocational Ministry to address substance abuse and cognitive thinking issues.  No contact with gangs or gang members.  Comply with any Family Court orders.  No driving without valid driver's license.  Take steps to obtain driver's license.  No contact with J.B. or Z.F.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: To be served during term of probation

Defendant Deon P Downs in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Deon P Downs in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
PSI received and reviewed; no additions or corrections
State's recommendation 15CF1280 - 5 yrs> 2 1/2 WPS 2 1/2 ES imposed and stayed, 3 yr probation.  Additional concurrent probation and the 2 misdemeanor files
Victim notification complied with.
Defense sentencing argument.  Requesting 1 yr WPS 1 yr ES imposed and stayed with 3 yrs probation.
Statement by defendant.
BTC: 15CF1280: Ct 1 -   5 yrs> 2 1/2 WPS 2 1/2 ES, imposed and stayed, 3 yr prob.  180 days RCJ imposed and stayed.
                               Ct 2:  1 yr probation concurrent
15CM1459 - 1 yr probation concurrent
 15CM1457 - dismissed and read-in at plea hearing
CIP and SAP eligible
no alcohol, controlled substances
Racine Vocation Ministry re AODA , cognitive thinking issues.  
no contact with gangs or gang members
firearm prohibition warning
voting prohibition
DNA sample and surcharge
costs waived
30 hrs CSW
compliant with any family court orders
no driving w/o license
take steps to obtain DL
no contact with J.B or Z .F
ZCI fees to be paid
No expungment granted by the Court

Defendant Deon P Downs in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the GPS monitor be removed.
St- Objects to the GPS monitor being removed.
BTC: Bond modification granted. GPS MONITOR TO BE REMOVED.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 2/25/2016 ALSO $1,000 CO SIGNATURE BOND WITH ANISSA SINDAY DOB 11-08-1995. $208 advanced fee for installment of GPS must be paid prior to release from jail. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).Placed on House Arrest at 1640 Charles Street Racine WI 53404. May only leave the house for court and meetings with attorney. No communication with the co defendant or the victim. May not have anyone at the house unless approved by his sister and may not have access to the internet. 


**AMENDED 6-6-2016 GPS MONITOR TO BE REMOVED.**
